DefaultEvent.Description: $Khan -> カーン, Admiralty -> 海軍省, Khanate -> カーネイト, Iron Republic -> アイアン・リパブリック$You spend half a day observing the docks and note an astonishing number and variety of ships. Was that a Khanate trimaran nestled beside a vessel from the Iron Republic? The dockhands complain loudly that they have never been busier. The Catties talk ceaselessly and carelessly about smuggling and piracy, but even the most hardened zailors lower their voices when they mention 'the King'. They go even quieter when they talk about the Rose Garden. You make careful notes; perhaps the Admiralty will understand what they mean, even if you don't.
DefaultEvent.Name: Roses and kings

ChildBranches.Name: $Port Report -> 港湾報告書$Compile a Port Report
ChildBranches.Description: $Admiralty -> 海軍省$Though the Isle seems, at present, beyond the reach of the Admiralty's laws, that does not mean that the Admiralty lacks interest in their activities.

DefaultEvent.Description: You hand over the coins and she tips you a sharp smile before waving you to the nearest alehouse. The entire process is straightforwardly corrupt, and pleasingly efficient.

ChildBranches.Name: A Piratical Welcome
ChildBranches.Description: $Isle of Cats -> アイル・オブ・キャッツ$"Welcome to the Isle of Cats," the Wide-Eyed Dockmaster says brightly. "Would you like to bribe me not to write down your details in this nice official ledger?"

ChildBranches.Name: The Honeyed Tongue
ChildBranches.Description: It is both brothel and honey-den, run by someone the Catties refer to as the King's Claw.

ChildBranches.Name: Cavendish Abbey
ChildBranches.Description: $lamplighter bee -> 灯点けミツバチ$The crimson-clad Melliferous Sisters patrol its ramparts, and tend their hives of lamplighter bees.

ChildBranches.Name: A Walk in the Rose Garden
ChildBranches.Description: What use is a key, if you don't open things with it?

DefaultEvent.Description: $Pirate-King -> 海賊王$The Melliferous Sister seems reluctant to sell the honey to you, until you show her your silver Key to the Cage Gardens. "You are an intimate of the Pirate-King!" she exclaims. "Well, why didn't you say so in the first place?"

ChildBranches.Name: Buy a shipment of red honey
ChildBranches.Description: $Revenue M[ae]n -> 徴税官$You could sell it for a profit elsewhere. If you were inclined to take your chances with the Revenue Men.

DefaultEvent.Description:
$Irem -> アイレム$"The Sun orders time, do you see? Down here we can only touch time with our fingers. The devils know that. In Irem - In Irem - "

His eyes well with tears. Abruptly he turns and plunges into the crowd. You're left with the crate.
DefaultEvent.Name: Life and light

ChildBranches.Name: A Gift of Glass
ChildBranches.Description: An emaciated man in lion-coloured robes clutches your sleeve. "Please," he says. "I'm damned. I can't touch the truth. Take this." He points to an unpromising-looking crate, sitting beside a bollard.

DefaultEvent.Description:
$[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$The blemmigan disappears into the crowd, darting between legs in a violet flash. Pirates shriek, harlots curse. 

An hour later, you see it perched atop an alehouse roof, tentacles awave, slurringly extemporising an impudent villanelle. A small crowd of locals is cheering.
DefaultEvent.Name: Gone in an instant

ChildBranches.Name: $[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$Put a blemmigan ashore
ChildBranches.Description: What will they make of it? What will it make of them?

DefaultEvent.Description:
King Leopold examines the small jeweled bird with care and a measure of delight. "I do not want to know how you came by this. Should anyone ask, you did not. We shall return it to the owner, yes. Such fine craftsmanship. A true one-of-a-kind creation."

He cradles it for a moment, and snaps off the head. "Deliver this to the Widow," he orders, throwing it to his least fortunate smuggler. "We have unfavourable deals to renegotiate."
DefaultEvent.Name: Caught in the middle

ChildBranches.Name: $Mr Sacks -> ミスター・サックス$A delivery for Mr Sacks
ChildBranches.Description: $Pirate-King -> 海賊王, Gracious Widow -> 心優しい未亡人$The Pirate-King will have contacts with the Gracious Widow.

DefaultEvent.Description:
$Hunter's Keep -> ハンターズ・キープ$You must lie on a bed in the semi-darkness, eyelids propped open and reflexes drug-dulled. Then the bees are admitted. Soon a scout has found you and is dancing out the address of your eyeballs. Now, concentrate! It would be unfortunate if you were to communicate the wrong memory through the bees! You must dwell on the Sensitive Brother's guilt about burning the papers, his lie to his superiors, his determination never to tell anyone. Meanwhile the feet of bees prickle across your eyes.

But when it is over you have a stoppered glass of red liquid, prepared for delivery at Hunter's Keep.
DefaultEvent.Name: An uncomfortable procedure

ChildBranches.Name: Have red honey made of the Sensitive Brother's Regret
ChildBranches.Description: It will let you convey his secret to his sister in a form she may find palatable.

DefaultEvent.Description:
They fall silent as you approach, and reach for their knives. You put your hands up. You've just come from those waters, you say, and there is something they ought to know.

By the time you've finished speaking, the smugglers have not only away their knives, they've started reaching for their purses. "A good bit of luck that you caught us," one says. "If I ever find the muggins what near sent us to our deaths, I'm going to bash 'is ____ing teeth in."

ChildBranches.Name: Save the smugglers from Wrack
ChildBranches.Description: A small crowd of smugglers whisper beneath a garland of roses. "She said a taste of this fish could rouse a parson's passions! We'll make a killing in London!" The rest agree to chart a course over Wrack.

ChildBranches.Name: $Ambition -> 大望$Ambition: Discuss the Well-Travelled Notary's memories
ChildBranches.Description: $Presbyter -> プレズビター$Your quest to has led you here. You need to know what the Notary knew - about Nidah, about the Presbyterate, about the secret of immortality.

ChildBranches.Name: $Ambition -> 大望$Ambition: Discuss the Well-Travelled Notary's memories
ChildBranches.Description: $Presbyter -> プレズビター$Your quest to has led you here. You need to know what the Notary knew - about Nidah, about the Presbyterate, about the secret of immortality.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Isery -> イザリー$You broach the subject with delicacy. There is a light in Isery's eyes that you would not describe as 'reassuring'.

ChildBranches.Name: $Isery -> イザリー$Invite Isery to join the seven Against Nidah
ChildBranches.Description: Given Lorenzo's misfortune, you find yourselves in need of a new Guide.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Isery -> イザリー$You broach the subject with delicacy. There is a light in Isery's eyes that you would not describe as 'reassuring'.

ChildBranches.Name: $Isery -> イザリー$Invite Isery to join the seven Against Nidah
ChildBranches.Description: Given Lorenzo's misfortune, you find yourselves in need of a new Guide.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Isery -> イザリー$The reports are all the same: Isery manages the Honeyed Tongue, a den of exceedingly select and debased pleasures. You'll have to win their favour if you're to taste the honey.
DefaultEvent.Name: $Isery -> イザリー$Isery, Cat's Chiefest Claw

ChildBranches.Name: $Ambition -> 大望$Ambition: Where can you taste red honey?
ChildBranches.Description: The Salt-Scarred Navigator said he tasted memories of a failed expedition against an immortal city. Where is the one who gave it to him?

SuccessEvent.Description:
"Yes. Yes, I'll pay. Where is it? Quickly!"

You wait outside while your customer basks in the sunlight. Once it starts to fade, you re-enter the room and retrieve your box.
SuccessEvent.Name: A good price

DefaultEvent.Description: $Mirrorcatch Box -> 鏡封じの箱$In back-rooms and cellars, in tangles behind warehouses, you make careful arrangements. The deal is only to take place at second hand: your intermediary will meet theirs. Unfortunately, their intermediary palms off yours with an empty crate, not the original Mirrorcatch Box. You're five hundred Echoes richer, but you'll need another box if you're to do this run again.
DefaultEvent.Name: Smoke and mirrors

ChildBranches.Name: Sell Sunlight
ChildBranches.Description: $Port Cavendish -> ポート・キャベンディッシュ$Sunlight! that most dangerous of pleasures. Here in Port Cavendish, there's an appetite for dangerous pleasures. But will you be able to negotiate with the sippers of sunlight?

SuccessEvent.Description:
You follow the Daughter's stunned gaze. A woman in a lilac gown leans in the doorway of a honey-den. Her features bear an unmistakable resemblance to your officer's. "We should talk," she says to the Daughter, quite calmly.

The Daughter assembles the rags of her composure with remarkable speed. "Excuse us," she says...
SuccessEvent.Name: "She was here last week, but - "

DefaultEvent.Description: "But, oh dear me, do you know someone picked my pocket?" She chuckles happily. "I never noticed a thing! Fingers like spider-hatchlings." She rolls a coin between her fingers. "So I tracked him down and congratulated him. And bought him a drink. And one thing led to another. And now he's asleep upstairs at the Rose and Tiger, and I'm down here with his purse. Would you like some money? It's so much fun, money." (You begin to realise how drunk she must be.) "Anyway, no luck. But we'll find her. I can find anyone." She tries, and fails, to snap her fingers.
DefaultEvent.Name: "No luck."

ChildBranches.Name: $Maybe's Daughter -> メイビーの娘$Help Maybe's Daughter search for her mother
ChildBranches.Description: "She comes here, I know. She's always been fond of cats. Well, my father was something of a cat. And a very noble one, at that."

Description:
A scatter of yellow-lit honey-dens and brightly painted alehouses. To the south-east rises the stone tower of Cavendish Abbey, its ramparts hung with crimson-and-gold banners. There are zailors from all across the Neath hauling cargo, dicing and brawling good-naturedly on the docks. 

The air carries the sound of zee-shanties sung with more enthusiasm than skill, and the smell of roses edged with brimstone.
Name: $Port Cavendish -> ポート・キャベンディッシュ$Port Cavendish
